<title level="1" pfs="">[Giant Flea](/Monsters.aspx?ID=501)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Giant fleas are commonly found in areas containing hardy megafauna, such as dinosaurs or mammoths.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/GiantFlea.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Giant Flea](/Monsters.aspx?ID=501)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Animal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=9" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On](/Sources.aspx?ID=21) pg. 83</row>

**Perception** +10; low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +9

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +3

**Con** +3

**Int** -5

**Wis** +1

**Cha** -4
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 19 

**Fort** +12 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +4 

</row>

**HP** 50

**Immunities**
disease

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
proboscis +12,
**Damage** 1d8+4 piercing plus Suck Blood and flea fever

**Suck Blood** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Requirements** The giant flea’s last action was a successful proboscis Strike; **Effect** The giant flea drinks the creature’s blood. The victim becomes drained 1 and the flea regains 5 HP.

**Flea Fever**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) Drain from flea fever can’t be reduced or recovered from naturally until the disease is cured. **Saving Throw** DC 18 Fortitude; **Stage 1** [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) (1d4 hours), **Stage 2** drained 1 and [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (1 day), **Stage 3** drained 2 and sickened 1 (1 day), **Stage 4** drained 3 and sickened 1 (1 day), **Stage 5** dead

</column>
